awd_titl_txt: Mathematical Sciences: Stark's Conjectures in Function      Fields and Number Fields
awd_abstract_narration: This award supports the research in number theory and                   arithmetic algebraic geometry of Professor David R. Hayes of the                University of Massachusetts at Amherst. One of Dr. Hayes's                      projects is to carry out a high-precision verification of the                   Refined Stark Conjecture for special values of a p-adic zeta                    function defined from a real quadratic field. Another project,                  more geometric in nature, is to settle completely a Goldbach-like               problem in function fields over finite fields. As with the Stark-               Conjecture problem, Dr. Hayes will make extensive use of                        supercomputers in these investigations.                                              Except for counting, number theory, which is the study of                  the properties of the whole numbers, is the oldest branch of                    mathematics. In modern days, problems in number theory have                     furnished the driving force to creation of new mathematics in the               fields of pure algebra, analysis, and geometry; some of the most                recent and most astonishing applications of number theory have                  appeared in theoretical computer science and coding theory.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Mathematical and Physical Sciences
